RankDef.description: A new enlistee in the Imperial Legion, undergoing basic training and learning the fundamentals of military discipline.
A support soldier in the Legion, responsible for logistics, engineering, and specialized tasks that support the main fighting force.
A fully trained soldier of the Imperial Legion, the backbone of the Empire's military might. Disciplined, loyal, and battle-tested.
An experienced legionary who has served with distinction through multiple campaigns and proven their valor in battle.
A squad leader responsible for ten legionaries, the first step in the Legion's command structure. Shows tactical skill and leadership potential.
A senior non-commissioned officer who assists centurions in managing century-level operations and training.
The standard bearer of a Legion century, responsible for carrying the unit's colors and maintaining unit cohesion in battle.
A horn blower who signals commands across the battlefield, crucial for coordinating large-scale military maneuvers.
A company-level commander responsible for leading a century of legionaries. The cornerstone of Legion leadership and tactical excellence.
The senior centurion of a Legion, responsible for the first cohort and serving as the senior tactical advisor to the Legion's commander.
A high-ranking officer often from the nobility, responsible for administrative duties and serving as second-in-command to the Legate.
The supreme commander of an Imperial Legion, appointed by the Emperor himself. Possesses both military genius and political authority.
A regional military administrator who oversees multiple Legion operations and coordinates with civilian authorities.
The highest military rank, commanding multiple Legions and reporting directly to the Emperor. Masters of grand strategy and imperial policy.
